circumstances: The approach to New Orleans-Lakefront Airport was completed in limited visibility due to low ceiling and foggy conditions. The twin engine airplane struck the water surface and crashed into Lake Pontchartrain. The wreckage was found about 400 yards to the left of the localizer and all seven occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Controlled collision with water on final approach due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Low ceiling, 
- Fog,
- Visibility 1/4 mile or less, 
- Weather conditions below minimums.
